alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 09 at 9:15PM CDT until May 09 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... South central Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 815 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 11 miles north of Oliver Campground, or 12 miles northwest of Kimball, moving east-northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Kimball and south central Banner Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
